Body: I'm not sure this can be answered objectively, because there are aspects of GDPR that have not undergone the necessary legal tests for anyone to reach reasonably-indisputable conclusions about what is and isn't permissible in many cases.  At this point, I would suggest that your questions are legal/regulatory, not technical.

Well, this is still a technical question, I believe, as the target is the architectural approach for such cases, rather than the regulatory itself. I think I'm not the first one who faced this issue, and hoped that guys who have also experienced the problem can suggest what design components could serve the three questions/scenarios I posted. Even if the solution is ad-hoc or not so objective. It is better to have a vision on possible alternatives, then nothing :)
